name: Arbosana
description: Fruity, nutty tones, with tasting notes of green tomato and almond. Creamy, delicate aftertaste. Drizzle over greens, saut√© vegetables, or grill fish. (Chile)

name: Arbequina
description: Smooth and elegant, with notes of green apple and almond. Great for salads, making pesto, or adding light flavor to roasted vegetables. (Chile)

name: Frantoio/Leccino
description: Displays a creamy, malty center & notes of green grass and wildflowers. Light yet fruity olive aroma. Turns even ordinary greens into gourmet delights. (Italy)

name: Hojiblanca
description: Robust olive flavor and aroma, with notes of ripe banana and apple. Pair with any balsamic vinegar, but especially Traditional, Juniper Berry or Pomegranate. (Spain)

name: Koroneiki
description: Exquisite and flavorful aroma. Fresh fruit-of-the-olive taste, with hints of artichoke and fresh grass.  Peppery aftertaste. Enjoy on salads, roasted meats, hearty vegetables. (Greece)

name: Manzanillo
description: Bold and sassy, displays gradual but lingering notes of citrus blossom and green apple. High in healthy throat-tickling polyphenols. (California)
